ğŸ’¡Aliases
01. Aliases(AS)
Aliases are used to give a table, or a column in a table, a temporary name. Aliases are often used to make column names more readable. An alias only exists for the duration of that query. An alias is created with theÂ ASÂ keyword.

entry.summary:
ğŸ’¡LIMIT
01. LIMIT
TheÂ LIMITÂ clause is used to specify the number of records to return. TheÂ LIMITÂ clause is useful on large tables with thousands of records. Returning a large number of records can impact performance.

entry.summary:
ğŸ’¡ORDER BY
01. ORDER BY
TheÂ ORDER BYÂ keyword is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order. TheÂ ORDER BYÂ keyword sorts the records in ascending order by default. To sort the records in descending order, use theÂ DESCÂ keyword.

entry.summary:
ğŸ’¡BETWEEN, IN, LIKE
01. BETWEEN
TheÂ BETWEENÂ operator selects values within a given range. The values can be numbers, text, or dates. TheÂ BETWEENÂ operator is inclusive: begin and end values are included.
